quote: The way I see it, our fates appear to be intertwined. In a land brimming with Hollows, could that really be mere chance? So, what do you say? Why not help one another on this lonely journey?
author: Solaire of Astora

quote: You really are fond of chatting with me, aren't you? If I didn't know better, I'd think you had feelings for me! Oh, no, dear me. Pretend you didn't hear that! Hah hah hah!
author: Solaire of Astora

quote: Anytime you see my brilliantly shining signature, do not hesitate to call upon me.
author: Solaire of Astora

quote: I'm glad to see you alive ...You have done well, indeed you have. You've a strong arm, strong faith, and most importantly, a strong heart. I am in awe, really.
author: Solaire of Astora

quote: Why not join me, as a warrior of the Sun? Righteous knights, guardians of all that is good, in the name of the Lord of Sunlight!
author: Solaire of Astora

quote: Exhilarating, is it not? The power of the Sun! I am blessed to have found such a brave companion! Hah hah hah!
author: Solaire of Astora

quote: ...Ahh, it's over... ...My Sun...it's setting... ...It's dark, so dark...
author: Solaire of Astora

quote: I became Undead to pursue this! But when I peer at the Sun up above, it occurs to meâ€¦ What if I am seen as a laughing stock, as a blind fool without reason?  Well, I suppose they wouldn't be far off! Hah hah hah!
author: Solaire of Astora

quote: We are amidst strange beings, in a strange land. The flow of time itself is convoluted; with heroes centuries old phasing in and out. The very fabric wavers, and relations shift and obscure.
author: Solaire of Astora

quote: There's no telling how much longer your world and mine will remain in contact. But, use this, to summon one another as spirits, cross the gaps between the worlds, and engage in jolly co-operation!
author: Solaire of Astora

quote: I am a warrior of the sun! Spot my summon signature easily by its brilliant aura. If you miss it, you must be blind!
author: Solaire of Astora

quote: Oh, hello there. I will stay behind, to gaze at the sun. The sun is a wondrous body. Like a magnificent father! If only I could be so grossly incandescent!
author: Solaire of Astora

quote: Prithee, be careful. I don't want to see m' work squandered!.
author: Blacksmith Andre of Astora

quote: Don't get yourself killed, neither of us wants to see you go Hollow.
author: Blacksmith Andre of Astora

quote: The nice thing about weapons...they never betray you. So pay them a little respect, eh?
author: Blacksmith Andre of Astora

quote: Sen's Fortress is an old proving ground built by the ancient gods. It is the only route to the great Anor Londo. Of course, most fools can't even find their way into that fortified deathtrap. But they won't stop trying! Take that bumbling Sir Onion... Hah hah hah!
author: Blacksmith Andre of Astora

quote: Hm? No, no, I'm fine, I'm fine. Well and wide awake! Do not treat me like an old withering snake.
author: Kingseeker Frampt

quote: I am the primordial serpent, Kingseeker Frampt, close friend of the Great Lord Gwyn. Chosen Undead, who has rung the Bell of Awakening. I wish to elucidate your fate. Do you seek such enlightenment?
author: Kingseeker Frampt

quote: Heavens! You have done it! You have retrieved the Lordvessel! After a thousand years! It is you, it is really you! Hraaaoogggh! ... Forgive me. I really should calm down. Now, let us take that vessel on a journey. I assume you are ready. Now, be still!
author: Kingseeker Frampt

quote: Ahh...ohh! The Lordvessel is satiated... Magnificent... You are the righteous successor to Gwyn, the new Great Lord. And I am Kingseeker no more... Your acquaintance was an honour.
author: Kingseeker Frampt

quote: I must admit, I am fond of you humans. May you enjoy your serendipity. And may the Age of Fire perpetuate.
author: Kingseeker Frampt
